clinical_study.brief_title: Couple-Based Meditation for Metastatic Lung Cancer Patients and Their Partners
clinical_study.official_title: Couple-Based Meditation for Metastatic Lung Cancer Patients and Their Partners

brief_summary.textblock:
Objectives:
Our specific aims are to:
Aim 1: Examine the feasibility of a couple-based meditation program in 50 patients with metastatic lung cancer and their partners.
Aim 2: Establish the initial efficacy of a couple-based meditation program in patients and their partners regarding physical, psychological, and spiritual quality of life outcomes.
Exploratory Aim: Explore potential intervention mediators (i.e., mindfulness, compassion, holding back, and intimacy) and a moderator (i.e., baseline distress) of the intervention effects.

detailed_description.textblock:
Phase 1:
If participant agrees to take part in this study, their demographic information (such as their age, sex, and race) will be recorded.
Meditation and Discussion Program:
Participant will take part in a meditation and discussion program. Two (2) times participant will meet with a mediation trained instructor. Participant should attend each session together as a couple.
During the sessions, participant will do deep breathing and visualization exercises and then asked to review the exercises based on their experiences and what they prefer. Participant will also be asked for feedback about the instructions to make sure they were clear and easy to follow. Participant will also be asked to read written materials that are part of this program. Participant will be asked to complete a written review about the program in general and a questionnaire about their general health and well-being. Each session will last about 60-90 minutes.
Length of Study Participation:
Patient's participation in this study will be over when they have completed the last session Phase 1.
This is an investigational study.
Up to 100 participant's and their partners (for a total of 200 participants) will take part in this study. This study has 3 phases to it: Phase 1 will include 15 couples (30 participants), Phase 2 will include 10 couples (20 participants), and Phase 3 will include 75 couples (150 participants). All will be enrolled at MD Anderson.
Phase 2:
If participant agrees to take part in this study, their demographic information (such as their age, sex, and race) will be recorded.
Questionnaires:
Participant will complete 12 questionnaires before their first meditation and discussion session. The questionnaires ask about participant's health, their mood, their level of fatigue, their sleeping habits, their relationship, and their quality of life. It should take about 45 minutes to complete these questionnaires.
After completing the last session, about 4 weeks later, participant will be asked to complete the same questionnaires again. Additionally, participant will be asked to complete a program review asking them what they liked and did not like about the program.
If participant cannot complete the questionnaires in the clinic, they will be given a self-addressed postage-paid envelope so that they can mail the questionnaires back to the study staff. Participant should try to finish and mail back the questionnaires no more than 7 days after they begin filling them out.
Meditation and Discussion Program:
Participant will take part in a meditation and discussion program. Each week for 4 weeks, participant will have a meditation class with a trained meditation instructor. Participant will attend up to 4 sessions. Participant should attend each session together as a couple.
During the meditation sessions, participant will do deep breathing and visualization exercises. Participant will discuss their experiences and observations afterwards with their partner and instructor. Each session will last about 60 minutes total.
Participant will be asked to continue daily meditation practice and some other short exercises at home outside of the classes. Participant will receive a compact disc and printed materials to help with their home practice.
The study staff will call participant 2 times per week over the 4-week period to remind them to practice their meditation. Participant will also be asked about any problems they may be having completing their practice. Each call should last about 10-15 minutes.
All meditation and discussion sessions will be videotaped. This is so the researchers can keep track of the quality of the sessions. The video files are digital and will be deleted after all the data are studied.
Length of Study Participation:
Patient's participation in this study will be over when they have completed the questionnaires within 1 week after their last session. Patient's total participation length for Phase 2 is about 4-6 weeks.
This is an investigational study.
Up to 100 participants and their partners (for a total of 200 participants) will take part in this study. This study has 3 phases to it: Phase 1 will include 15 couples (30 participants),Phase 2 will include 10 couples (20 participants), and Phase 3 will include 75 couples (150 participants). All will be enrolled at MD Anderson.
Phase 3:
If participant agrees to take part, their medical history and demographic information (such as their age, sex, and race) will be recorded. By signing this consent, participant also agrees that their partner will be asked to take part in this study.
Participant will complete 13 questionnaires at the beginning of this study. The questionnaires ask about participant's health, any symptoms they may be having, their mood, their level of fatigue, their sleeping habits, their relationship, and their quality of life. It should take about 45 minutes to complete these questionnaires.
If participant cannot complete the questionnaires in the clinic, they will be given a self-addressed postage-paid envelope so that they can mail the questionnaires back to the study staff. Participant should try to finish and mail back the questionnaires no more than 7 days after they begin filling them out.
Study Groups:
Participant will be randomly assigned (as in the flip of a coin) to 1 of 3 groups. This is done because no one knows if one study group is better, the same, or worse than the other group:
- If participant is in Group 1, they will take part in a couple-based meditation and discussion program.
- If participant is in Group 2, they will take part in a couple-based cancer-related discussion program.
- If participant is in Group 3, they will not take part in the couple-based meditation or cancer-related discussion program but will complete the same questionnaires as Group 1 and 2. Participant will be given the option to take part in the couple-based mediation and discussion program (off study) after the other groups finish their last questionnaire packet.
The group assignment is based on other factors such as participant's age and gender.
Meditation and Discussion Program for Group 1:
If participant is in Group 1, they will take part in a meditation and discussion program. Each week for 4 weeks, participant will have a meditation class with a trained meditation instructor. Participant should attend each session together as a couple.
During the meditation sessions, participant will do deep breathing and visualization exercises. Participant will discuss their experiences and observations afterwards and engage in structured discussion with their partner and interventionist. Each session will last about 60 minutes total.
Participant will be asked to continue daily meditation practice and some other short exercises at home outside of the classes. Participant will receive a compact disc and printed materials to help with their home practice.
The study staff will call participant 2 times per week over the 4-week period to remind them to practice their meditation. Participant will also be asked about any problems they are having completing their practice. Each call should last about 10-15 minutes.
Cancer-Related Discussion Program for Group 2:
If participant is in Group 2, they will take part in a discussion program. Participant will have 1 discussion session each week for 4 weeks with a trained interventionist. These will be one-on-one sessions.
During the discussion sessions, participant will discuss issues for couples coping with cancer.
Each session will last about 60 minutes.
For Groups 1 and 2:
All meditation and discussion sessions will be videotaped. This is so the researchers can keep track of the quality of the sessions. The video files are digital and will be deleted after all the data are studied.
All Groups:
Participant will complete the same questionnaires they completed at the beginning of the study, 4 weeks later, and again 3 months later.
Length of Study Participation:
Patient's participation on this study will be over when they have completed the questionnaires at 3 months after their last session for Phase 3.
This is an investigational study.
Up to 100 participants and their partners (for a total of 200 participants) will take part in this study. This study has 3 phases to it: Phase 1 will include 15 couples (30 participants), Phase 2 will include 10 couples (20 participants), and Phase 3 will include 75 couples (150 participants). All will be enrolled at MD Anderson.

primary_outcome.description: Efficacy based on physical, psychological, and spiritual quality of life outcomes. T-tests used to compare the pre-post change in the quality of life (QOL) outcomes between interventions separately for the participants and caregivers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. ALL PHASES, PATIENTS ONLY: Diagnosed with stage IV Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)
2. ALL PHASES, PATIENTS ONLY: Currently receiving treatment (e.g. radiotherapy, chemotherapy) at MD Anderson Cancer Center
3. ALL PHASES, PATIENTS ONLY: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of less than or equal to 2
4. ALL PHASES, PATIENTS ONLY: Have a romantic partner with whom they have resided for a minimum of 6 months
5. ALL PHASES, PATIENTS AND PARTNERS: Must be at least 18 years old
6. ALL PHASES, PATIENTS AND PARTNERS: Able to read and speak English
7. PHASES 2 AND 3, PATIENTS AND PARTNERS: Able to participate in 4 weekly sessions at MD Anderson Cancer Center
8. ALL PHASES, PATIENTS AND PARTNERS: Able to provide consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. ALL PHASES, PATIENTS AND PARTNERS: Not oriented to time, place, or person as deemed by the clinical team
2. ALL PHASES, PATIENTS AND PARTNERS: Regular (self-defined) participation in psychotherapy or a formal cancer support group
3. ALL PHASES, PATIENTS AND PARTNERS: Prior enrollment in a couple-based mind-body intervention research study (protocols 2011-1179, 2013-0496, 2014-0036) conducted by the principal investigator including phase 1 or phase 2 of the current study.
